verses.verse: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her (Lev. 20:14) daughter, nor shall you take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness. They are near of kin to her. It is wickedness.
Nor shall you take a woman (1 Sam. 1:6, 8) as a rival to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the other is alive.
‘Also you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness as (Ezek. 18:6) long as she is in her (Lev. 15:24; 20:18) customary impurity.
((Prov. 6:25-33)) Moreover you shall not lie carnally with your (Ex. 20:14; Lev. 20:10; (Matt. 5:27, 28; 1 Cor. 6:9; Heb. 13:4)) neighbor’s wife, to defile yourself with her.

And you shall not let any of your descendants (Lev. 20:2-5; Deut. 12:31) pass through (2 Kin. 16:3) the fire to (1 Kin. 11:7, 33; Acts 7:43) Molech, nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
You shall not lie with (Lev. 20:13; Rom. 1:27) a male as with a woman. It is an abomination.
Nor shall you mate with any (Ex. 22:19; Lev. 20:15, 16; Deut. 27:21) animal, to defile yourself with it. Nor shall any woman stand before an animal to mate with it. It is perversion.
(Matt. 15:18-20; 1 Cor. 3:17) ‘Do not defile yourselves with any of these things; (Lev. 18:3; 20:23; Deut. 18:12) for by all these the nations are defiled, which I am casting out before you.
For (Num. 35:33, 34; Ezek. 36:17) the land is defiled; therefore I (Is. 26:21; Jer. 5:9) visit the punishment of its iniquity upon it, and the land (Lev. 18:28; 20:22) vomits out its inhabitants.
(Lev. 18:5, 30) You shall therefore keep My statutes and My judgments, and shall not commit any of these abominations, either any of your own nation or any stranger who dwells among you
(for all these abominations the men of the land have done, who were before you, and thus the land is defiled),
lest (Jer. 9:19) the land vomit you out also when you defile it, as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
For whoever commits any of these abominations, the persons who commit them shall be cut off from among their people.

‘Therefore you shall keep My ordinance, so (Lev. 18:3; 22:9) that you do not commit any of these abominable customs which were committed before you, and that you do not defile yourselves by them: (Lev. 18:2) I am the LORD your God.’ ”
(Moral and Ceremonial Laws) And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them: (Ex. 19:6; Lev. 11:44; 20:7, 26; (Eph. 1:4); 1 Pet. 1:16) ‘You shall be holy, for I the LORD your God am holy.
(Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16; Matt. 15:4; Eph. 6:2) ‘Every one of you shall revere his mother and his father, and (Ex. 16:23; 20:8; 31:13) keep My Sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
(Ex. 20:4; Ps. 96:5; 115:4-7; 1 Cor. 10:14; (Col. 3:5)) ‘Do not turn to idols, (Ex. 34:17) nor make for yourselves molded gods: I am the LORD your God.
‘And (Lev. 7:16) if you offer a sacrifice of a peace offering to the LORD, you shall offer it of your own free will.
It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day. And if any remains until the third day, it shall be burned in the fire.
And if it is eaten at all on the third day, it is an abomination. It shall not be accepted.
Therefore everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the hallowed offering of the LORD; and that person shall be cut off from his people.
(Lev. 23:22; Deut. 24:19-22) ‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
And you shall not glean your vineyard, nor shall you gather every grape of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
(Ex. 20:15, 16) ‘You shall not steal, nor deal falsely, (Jer. 9:3-5; Eph. 4:25) nor lie to one another.
And you shall not (Ex. 20:7; Deut. 5:11; (Matt. 5:33-37; James 5:12)) swear by My name falsely, (Lev. 18:21) nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
(Ex. 22:7-15, 21-27; Mark 10:19) ‘You shall not cheat your neighbor, nor rob him. (Deut. 24:15; Mal. 3:5; James 5:4) The wages of him who is hired shall not remain with you all night until morning.
You shall not curse the deaf, (Deut. 27:18) nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shall fear your God: I am the LORD.

‘You shall do no injustice in (Deut. 16:19) judgment. You shall not (Ex. 23:3, 6; Deut. 1:17; 10:17; Ps. 82:2) be partial to the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty. In righteousness you shall judge your neighbor.

You shall not go about as a (Prov. 11:13; 18:8; 20:19) talebearer among your people; nor shall you (Ex. 23:7; Deut. 27:25; 1 Kin. 21:7-19) take a stand against the life of your neighbor: I am the LORD.
((1 John 2:9, 11; 3:15)) ‘You shall not hate your brother in your heart. (Matt. 18:15; (Luke 17:3); Eph. 5:11) You shall surely rebuke your neighbor, and not bear sin because of him.

((Deut. 32:35; 1 Sam. 24:12; Rom. 12:19; Heb. 10:30)) You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, (Matt. 5:43; 19:19; Mark 12:31; Luke 10:27; (Rom. 13:9; Gal. 5:14); James 2:8) but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the LORD.
‘You shall keep My statutes. You shall not let your livestock breed with another kind. You shall not sow your field with mixed seed. Nor shall a garment of mixed linen and wool come upon you.

‘Whoever lies carnally with a woman who is (Deut. 22:23-27) betrothed to a man as a concubine, and who has not at all been redeemed nor given her freedom, for this there shall be scourging; but they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
And he shall bring his trespass offering to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, a ram as a trespass offering.
The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he has committed. And the sin which he has committed shall be forgiven him.
‘When you come into the land, and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall count their fruit as uncircumcised. Three years it shall be as uncircumcised to you. It shall not be eaten.
